text: 5 stars for the chai latte at Tipsy- best chai I've found in Vegas.  Spicy and not overly sweet, and major bonus points for being able to order it with almond or soy milk.  The chocolates here are also great- the s'mores bar is graham cracker-y, peanut buttery amazingness.  Definitely a spot worth checking out.
Good coffee, fresh roast beans. We had ours over ice and was perfect inside on a warm day. Interesting choice of locations, but what the heck, we know where it is.

Wow. This was literally the most amazing thing. So this was the first time i had ever had a truffle (they're like a cake in the inside). I had a red velvet cake truffle and a peanut butter truffle. The twist is that these truffles had LIQUOR in them! I guess I shouldn't be surprised since this is vegas, lol. But the chocolate was super high quality- and I'm a bit of a chocoholic. The red velvet cake had brandy in it and the peanut butter had amaretto. I don't drink much, but the alcohol wasn't overpowering, just enough to give it flavor. Soooo good I almost melted when I ate them. Pure decadence. I wish the company did shipping!

Went back again yesterday and it was just as amazing. The coffees are great, by boyfriend gets the blue velvet latte which sounds odd (it's blueberry and white chocolate I believe) but it works so well with the coffee. I got the cookie butter latte, just as good as it sounds. It's unique and in a great location, I'm always surprised it's not busier.

I've tried Tipsy a few times now and will definitely be back. The espresso drinks are yummy but I am mostly addicted to the chocolates! The iced "Allie Baba" drink is my favorite. It's a great blend of white mocha and salted caramel. Andrew (the barista) makes it perfect every  time! As for sweets -- I love the homemade peanut butter cups! You also can't go wrong with the white chocolate caramel nut popcorn. The gluten free chocolate chip cookies are amazing too. If you have a sweet tooth, go visit Tipsy!
Terrible. Don't go even if you're forced to.Watery chai, gross and bitter coffee, slow.
Nice clean environment, it's very relaxing spending an afternoon here. Friendly staffs, reasonable prices, lots of choices on the menu. I love their chocolate! Red valvet is my favorite!

Nothing vegan here except for coffee and an overpriced cup of instant oatmeal.  Trays filled with beautiful looking pastries and truffles and not one vegan. When I asked if any were vegan, I got the reply "No, but we have gluten-free".  Umm... NOT. THE. SAME. THING.  Great way to turn off vegans from returning.

$5 for a little cup of instant oatmeal made with almond milk instead of water? Not even an ubiqutious "grilled veggie sandwich".  Coffee was OK but reminded me of instant.  You know, when you pour hot water into instant and you get that brown foamish ring at the top?  When I order coffee at other shops, I don't get that ring from fresh-brewed/poured coffee.  Maybe it was steamed to make it hotter?  Who knows? 

It was OK for an one-time stop, but I'll stick to Sunrise simply for having more vegan options (like pastries and sandwiches) and better tasting plain coffee (and additions like agave).
10/10 would come back again for these amazing chocolate truffles! I really enjoyed the great atmosphere at the cafe!!
Come here all the time! Love your iced coffee. Great customer service!! (Young darker skinned man) was such a sweet heart and helped me pick my selection. Highly recommend

Pretty good truffles and drops, but very mediocre at best coffee. The place is in the middle of nowhere... Near Southern Hills hospital but nothing else. The barista made three mistakes on the order of 4 items. The decor is bland, and AC is up too high. The seats were comfortable, but frankly my recommendation is get the truffles in a bag and go to Starbucks.  Or even Dunkin Donuts. 

These guys apparently make the truffles for a bunch of places in town, so they are pretty good, but they don't know the coffee business. 

If they throw out their coffee vendor and get Peet's I'll change the review to 3 stars.

Have now visited this lovely coffee house several times. The coffee, teas and various foods and deserts are excellent.  The service has always been over the top and my friends and partners are making it our go to place in the area.

Locally owned coffee shops are a rarity in Vegas, so the fact that this one exists is, in itself, a nice thing. However, as far as coffee shops go, this one is pretty low on my list of good coffee shops in Vegas, even lower on the list that some of the larger chain brand coffee shops.

Food - avoid it. They get sandwiches and salads pre-made and stored in their refrigerator with not a clear answer as to how old it is. Upon eating one, it really lacked in quality, it was smooshy and tasted old. 

Truffles - never had any, but Tipsy Coffee is a breakout from the Tipsy Truffle makers. They seem to be quality made and have enough of a following to allow for a coffee house venture to be afforded, so they can't be all that bad. 

Coffee - seriously meh. They have a lot of custom coffee creations but are frequently inconsistently made depending on who the barista is. As I look at the iced mocha i purchased, I can see powdered chocolate sitting unstirred at the bottom of my cup. Quality here is consistently questionable even after they have been open for better than 8 months. They might want to stick with truffles. 

Atmosphere - frustratingly disappointing. This has the potential to be a nice place to get some work done. They offer free wifi and have a large work table with a convenient tabletop power supply hub and USB. The furniture is good for lounging and works well enough. My bigest complaint are the big screen TV's playing FOX NEws. Politics aside, when I choose to get away from the hustle of the day and go someplace relaxing to get a little work done or have a nice chat with a friend, the last thing I want is to be inundated with an antagonistic news channel coming at me from two directions, albeit muted, nonetheless personally annoying. If my battery weren't about to die, I would definitely spare myself from the onslaught of fear journalism.  When I first came here near to their opening, I suggested putting something more universally friendly on the TV's if they HAVE to have them on, the manager literally laughed and shook his head when I suggested the Planet Earth series  as an example of an alternative.

Located in a business complex with several health related business and next to a hospital, this shop has a relatively captive audience and a wonderfully niche potential to be something great in a city where local coffee shops are a rarity. Unfortunately, it falls seriously short on execution and chooses to aim for the bottom of its customers expectations rather than aspiring to something greater.

This is a great neighborhood coffee shop! Wonderful staff that is attentive and friendly.  
Great fresh baked items truffles and cordials.
TERRIBLE! Iced coffee no ice.. pb latte disgusting and cold.. scone not cooked through.. will NEVER go back! Save your $$ & go to Starbucks!

Pros:

- Nice selection of drinks...nifty names.  Nice selection of sweets/edibles.

- They gots Boba...says the mini sign!

- Great decor!

Cons:

- Customer Service...they need more than one person...or at least a person who can get the orders correct while making the orders.  Get your ish together, cause there is a cafe two doors down with some good offerings as well!

- Better/bigger signs of all the offerings versus paper signs over plastic/clear film.

- Tried The Red Velvet Latte...was supposed to be The Blue Velvet Latte...ehhh, no special taste.

Stars:

- N/A

My husband and I stopped here for coffee before going to the water park.  I ordered the Cookie Butter Latte and a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on a croissant.  My husband had a regular coffee and the spinach, egg and cheese on a bagel.

I enjoyed the latte and felt the flavors were pretty balanced.  The sandwich was awesome.  The eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly and felt very fluffy and light.  I thought there was a bit too much cheese on the sandwich, particularly after it had started to cool down, so I ended up taking some of it off.  My husband had the same thoughts about his sandwich, but we both really enjoyed them and it was almost too much food for us to eat at breakfast.  My husband said his coffee was great, but noted there wasn't any creamer or milk.

Service is a little slow.  I don't know if the lady at the counter was working by herself or not, but it took awhile to get the drink and then the sandwiches out.  She was kind enough about it and asked if everything was okay once we got our food.  Just something to note if you're in a bit of a rush.

We'll probably stop by here again on our next trip.  I didn't get a chance to try any of the pastries or desserts and they looked very tempting.

The Nutella latte was delicious! The barista upgraded my latte because I had to wait so long, but it was worth the wait since it tasted fresh. Their menu features not so common coffee flavors that I'd drive back to try. Also the ambiance of the cafe is perfect for a meeting or to study. Definitely a step up from the average coffee chain. Prices were higher, but then again they use organic coffee. If your in the area it's worth the trip!

Not bad, but my verdict is not solid yet either. I came in because of the reviews to grab a quick snack. I tried there milk chocolate truffle which was good and a pecan chocolate brownie. They tasted fresh but also not go out of my way to get. The gentlemen who assisted me was nice and got me a fresh piece of chocolate from the back. When I'm in the area, I will need to try their coffee and some more sweets, since I'm there.

I went in here on a Friday with my girlfriend. Very nice experience, and the coffee is well made. They even bring it to you which is very nice. I liked it so much I even tried to bring my dad in today.

My problem with the place is that, I "tried" to come in today. I checked to see what time they open and it said 8. So we got up and waited a little bit and headed down there. 

We got there at 8:30 and no one was there. They either need to update their information or someone needs to set their alarm clock.

I'm really sad about this.  I adore the chocolates and the story of this place.  So much, I ordered a set of truffles online for my Mother for Mother's Day. No communication things weren't going well.  Mother's Day came and went, no chocolates.  I called the day after to speak with someone but was informed she had nothing to do with the online.  I was told I would be called back by someone who is.  No call.  This morning I got an email saying I had been refunded.  No communication.....hence the 2 stars

I stopped in today to get a box of chocolate covered strawberries for my gf. The employee was very courteous and even put the strawberries in a nice box and wrapped it for me. My gf loved the strawberries! I'm definitely coming back to this cool little spot.

If I could choose to give zero stars I would. Ordered an iced Americano, when it was ready it had no ice. The drink tasted like watered down day old coffee. Whether you're tipsy or dead sober this place blows.
Amazing coffee, great service, lovely ambience..so glad I found this place near my house! Will definitely be back. Love the relaxed atmosphere and drink options they offer :)

Nice friendly café with delicious pastries truffles, sandwiches, soup and made to order lattés 
We always stop here when we are on this side of town

Very quaint spot that I stumbled across in a medical district. We ordered the house chicken salad sandwich and three coffees. Fantastic food!! And coffee is local brewed and organic. The decor has a homestyle feel. I wish they had a cafe by my home!!! I highly recommend this cafe if you are in the area!!

This is the best bakery I have ever been to! Alcohol filled truffles?! The Debbie Double Mint was my favorite. I would definitely recommend coming here next time to satisfy the "sweet tooth". Cute gift ideas also.

Great atmosphere and I love the outside seating for a quiet place to study. I got an iced coffee and Hawi Ian banana bread both of which were delicious. I would definitely recommend supporting this local coffee shop.

Tipsy Truffles offers desserts that I'v never seen sold at any other bakeries... Alcohol filled truffles!!
I tried two yesterday, the Debbie Double Mint, and Zanes Whiskey Ginger, and they were both delicious!  This is really cute place for dessert gift ideas, and I cant wait to try more!

I love my cup with lid and straw that comes with a lively T-shirt; this place is so nice, delicious, unique and with very beautiful gifts for any occasion. Try the truffles, play some table games, browse internet, homework or just watch tv!   Meet Miss Jamie, she makes all the above mentioned ever better!

Cute spot, with the homey-comfy feel that was evident in the early Starbucks before they went global.  There are several comfortable seating options grouped around the shop and a fantastic soundtrack playing in the background.  
They have an extensive menu for flavored coffees, and I really enjoyed the white chocolate raspberry latte!  However, the scone I purchased was just as dry as most pastries available in coffee shops these days.  Why is it so hard to do both well at the same time?  Oh, well.  If I find myself back in the area I would return for the coffee.

2 stars for good friendly service. Lavender scone? Sounded interesting but bottom was completely burned and overall just wasn't that good. Soup was watery and no chunks of veggies or any substance to it.  Could've been microwaved straight from a can for all I know. Left hungry.

This coffee shop is the bomb ! My daughter , son-in-law & I stopped in yesterday, and enjoyed a pleasurable experience. They host a friendly staff wide range of products that really gives coffee a great twist, hence the name "TIPSY COFFEE HOUSE" loved it!
Please go try the cookie butter latte!! It is the best thing I've had to drink in a long time.

Have passed this place many times, but never stopped.  Was in an office nearby and decided to check them out.  They seemed slow, but it was a weekday afternoon. Barista was super nice and baked items looked really yummy.  I might have to come back for the raspberry and cream cheese croissant next time.  Was thinking about giving 4 starts just because they are a bit pricey: wouldn't be my regular place for that reason, but would come back.

Cute little place.  No drive in but cozy inside.  Don't have the usual "snacks", they're totally into candy so don't expect to get a sandwich here.  I used to own a coffee shop and it reminds me of what we had.  I would recommend it for those that like "non-franchise" coffee shops with unique flair...

Best coffee in Vegas. The treats look great too. Going to make this my regular stop.

Coming from Portland, and moving to Vegas, is a shock to my normally highly caffeinated senses. Finding mostly boring coffee franchises in Vegas is really disappointing, but Tipsy Coffee House is a bright spot in thIs town. It is hard for me to believe that a 24 hour city like Vegas doesn't have a surplus of great coffee places, but finding one will have to do.

Give it a try from a coffee snob. Where ever you are in Vegas, a trip to Tipsy is worth the trip.

Chocolate red velvet cake truffles were delicious. 
Blue velvet latte - phenomenal!
Customer service- awesome!
They have a variety of truffles and coffee flavors. Can't wait to try them all.

I was here yesterday when I was taking a senior to a doctors appointment. I decided to get  medium latte. I was shocked when the lady charged me 5.40. I thought that was a bit high. I went to my car and checked the menu. A medium latte is 3.70.Needless to say I wsa pissed and will never go back. The coffee was also just fair. Cute place but check your bill so you do not get ripped off too! Shame on tipsy coffee shop for over charging!!!!
open every second Thursday from 6pm-8pm for Verbal Jab poetry nights

Amazing coffee, food and even better service! These girls were super sweet and efficient. I got a blended Kimbos nutter butter and a peanut butter cookie, which are both fantastic!! I will definitely be coming back. If you haven't checked this place out, make it a must on your list.

In the days where Starbucks is all the rage, I am excited to find a local business that is really delicious. I love their selection of beverages, which are all at a great price point. I don't drink coffee or tea, but they made the drinks work for me. 
I really enjoyed the breakfast bagel I had, it was very filling. I am not a sweets person but they have LOADS of sweet treats. Only disappointment was when I went to order soup because I like to eat savory food and that was it on their menu, they were out of everything. 
BUT I  guess it left me wanting more because I will definitely be back to get some! 
I recommend making it your new coffee spot.

A co worker recommended this place due to my love of coffee. The place is so quant and comfortable feeling. They have liquor infused truffles that are delish! I recommend the lemoncello one, it is not a strong liquor taste and the lemon taste is not overpowering. The coffee is a nice smooth taste and the flavoring tastes natural and complimentary to the coffee. The woman that waiting on me was very friendly and patient while it took me a while to figure out which truffle I wanted to try. This place was definitely added to my favorite coffee places in Vegas. If you are up to try a new coffee spot I would highly encourage you to give this place a try!

Where has this been all this time?!  Such a cute place.  I hung around for 2 hours chatting with a friend.  I got the Nutter Butter espresso which was tasty, but I could've used more coffee flavor.  I consider that my fault.  I had a breakfast sandwich which was so tasty & big!  Could've totally shared it, but was so good I ate it myself.  Then topped it off with a smores bar which was amazing!  I'll be back for sure, especially to pick up their liqueur chocolates for gift giving.

Love this place. It's a piece of San Francisco in the middle of LV. The coffee and espresso selection is great. Their baked goods are delicious and their alcoholic chocolates are SO yummy. Coming NY 2013 they're starting food too. Internet is reliable and free. I sit here hours at a time doing my work. Also the staff is really helpful when deciding new drinks, and they make it to your taste (i.e., light on pumpkin flavor, light roast espresso, etc).

What a hidden gem! This place has been next to a few of my doctors and I regret not stopping in earlier! Everything is seriously delicious and all of the options look enticing. It's like this place caters exactly to my taste buds.

Best Coffee on the West side of Vegas! 

Reviews are hard because you want to trust the reviewer. Coffee is hard too because some are like "Yeah Starbucks" while my kind of coffee is the artisan, micro-roasted coffee house coffee. Living in LA for some years I visited many great coffee houses and long for a similar scene in Vegas.

Tipsy uses the coffee from Sunrise cafe. The owner is extremely friendly and the customer service from the staff is EXCELLENT! I came in my first visit and left feeling like a regular! 

Her pastries are great and go well with the coffee. I've enjoyed everything from her coffee to lattes. Drink up and support your local privately owned businesses!!! :)

I stopped in since I was in the area and in need of a pick me up.  A quaint place that offers up different coffee drinks other than the same ol', same ol' of Starbucks.  I was greeted immediately by a friendly employee. I think she was actually the only one working at the time.  She showed me the menu of the unique items they had to offer.  Plus it didn't hurt that their treats were nicely displayed next to the ordering counter.  There were also fresh croissants and other breakfast items. Everything looked very tempting...  but my will power kicked in.

They had many drinks that were made with Nutella.  I decided on the 'Salty Scottie' ~ A Nutella latte with salted caramel.  My drink was finished quickly and went in for a taste.  So delicious! A different flavor with the Nutella.  It was my first time trying something with that and was very happy that I did.

As I was waiting for my latte, I noticed a large dining area with couches, comfy chairs and many tables.  The area was very clean and tidy with windows surrounding so it lit the area nicely.  

So if you happen to be in the area, stop in for a great coffee drink!  They also offer lunch specials with a sandwich, chips and drink ~ so  maybe next time Tipsy!

Super nice staff. We found this place by accident and now my friend's and I meet there often for coffee. They have great sandwiches and food options for a coffee place. The atmosphere is comfortable and cozy. Lots better than sbux and not as pretentious. My only complaint is that they usually only have one person working so it can be slow if it's busy.

My mom & I stopped in for some coffee and a bite to eat after a doctor's appt. Immediately we were greeted by a lovely young lady whom I assumed was the owner. She offered us to sit where ever we wanted & gave us the remote to the t.v. Very welcoming!  we definitely plan on visiting Tipsy Coffee House in the near future!

Small coffee shop by the hospital- BF stops in here frequently and has been raving about the blue velvet drink. Finally made it in here to try it myself, and was pleasantly surprised by the cafe.

Ample seating, friendly staff, well-stocked pastry case with a selection of "tipsy truffles"- alcohol infused chocolates. There's also a full lunch menu with soups and sandwiches. Coffee menu has several iced and hot options.

Blue Velvet was underwhelming. BF said the balance was off and it wasn't as good as usual. I think I would have preferred the red velvet, which is a raspberry version.

This is a great spot for coffee and sweet treats. They have a variety of delicious drinks and house made sweets. Their truffles are unique and the case looks so pretty that I never know what to choose lol. They have a section with adult truffles that are filled with booze and are unique to other truffles I've had. A few days ago I had tried their s'mores bar which is huge btw and it was fu***** amazing!!! Inside was filled with graham cracker, marshmallow, crunchy peanut butter, and caramel. On the top, they toasted some marshmallow and topped it with salty peanuts. I left with one and drove home sad because I could have eaten five. My only complaint is that they aren't closer to my place lol other than that, they definitely deserve five stars.
Short and sweet version- friendly staff, laid back atmosphere, free wifi and one of the best bear claws I've ever had.

Delicious and fun desserts that are made with different alcoholic beverages. This is a fun little shop to stop by while exploring the Vegas Strip. 

Wild Willie's Coconut Tipsy Truffle - this one was my favorite. Delicious white cake with white chocolate and chewy pieces of dried coconut.

Tom & John's Red Velvet Tipsy Truffle - a beautiful ruby red color, with a very sweet red velvet chocolate flavor.

Dan's Double Fudge Baileys Tipsy Truffle  - this has a nice balance of fudge flavors and you could also taste the Baileys.

Zane's Whiskey Ginger Tipsy Truffle - I was glad that the ginger and whiskey was light and not overwhelming in flavor. The caramel drizzle was very chewy.

Also got to try orange peach ciroc drop which was a fun little burst of sweet with alcohol flavor. 

Service was good. I was a little disappointed that there were no pamphlets or menus available for customers. Prices are reasonable, truffles are $3 and drops are $2. 

Overall tasty and fun truffles that add to the Vegas experience. I would consider coming back for more truffles in the future.

If you live in Las Vegas please take a second to read this! I was at Tipsy Coffee House this morning around 9:30am and upon ordering saw a jar sitting on the counter. I was unnerved and a little bit annoyed because I wasn't sure if it was suppose to be a joke or if it was a true donation jar. A few hours later I was still thinking about this "tip jar" and called the coffeehouse. After 4 attempts a male named Andrew answered and I asked him if this jar was in fact a "tip jar" or a "donation jar", to which he replied "a tip jar" I asked him if it was a joke and if he thought it was funny to which he responded "uhhh, yea". The note on the jar it reads (EBOLA FUN-D a little goes a long way). Personally, I find this distasteful, disrespectful and to me it's not funny nor is it a joke. I will never go back to this establishment and I encourage you all to avoid it as well. There are too many bad things going on in this world,and I would prefer not to give my hard earned money to a place that thinks a worldwide sickness that has killed thousands of people is a joke.

Been coming here since it opened. Close to Southern hills hospital. Free wireless Internet. Open early in the morning. Great coffee and pastries.  Especially the alcohol infused truffles! Mmm. Nice atmosphere. The music can be a little loud though. Beats generic chains like Starbucks in my book! And every 10 coffees you get one free :)

Place was empty when I walked in. Monday around 2 pm. The service was okay, not too long and not too fast.  I ordered the croissant ham and cheese sandwich with a drink and chips. It was nothing to write home about, the croissant was pre-made at the bakery there I'm sure, and the ham was probably store bought with cheddar cheese. The price was $8 so it didn't kill the wallet. I think they need some more lunch/sandwich variety, maybe take some notes from the Baguette Cafe?

Best truffles anywhere. I really enjoy the dark chocolate but you can't go wrong with any truffle you get. My wife and kids love the white chocolate and the milk chocolate.  Everything they sell is great but don't miss out on the turtles.
Absolutely fantastic coffee, desserts and chocolates. Great service too at very reasonable prices.  Love it.

They have the BEST CHAI EVER. The owner supposedly spent years perfecting her own chai recipe and it sure is great. 

It's a cute and cozy cafe and they play cool music too. The staff is always super friendly and their pastries and baked in house and taste fresh. I haven't tried their truffles but my sister has and she seems to really like them. I hope they get more business because it really is a great place and they have waaay better drinks than Madhouse.

My colleague and I had some business to tend to at Southern Hills Hospital but had about 30 minutes to spare before our appointment so decided to stop by this place to get a quick bite to eat beforehand.  We originally wanted to go to Layers Bakery next door, but it was 7:40am and they didn't open until 8.  So we walked into Tipsy's.  My first impression was that this was a neat coffee shop and possible place to come and work and bring clients to.   My colleague ordered an egg and cheese sandwich and a bottle of diet coke.  I ordered the dark chocolate croissant.  I noticed the chocolate display and asked if there were any Valentine's Day specials as it was Feb.13, the day before.  She looked at me and said "not yet!"  What a strange answer for the day before Valentines!  I asked about pricing and she seemed a little distracted and I never got that answer.  I certainly may have been sold a box of truffles for my wife if she had any desire to try - she didn't so I didn't.

There was only one person in front of us, so we thought this would be fairly quick.  My colleague and I started to have a conversation for about ten minutes when I noticed that the girl who took our order brought out a carton of eggs, a bucket of chopped ham and a bag of cheese and placed it on the back counter.  We had thought that maybe someone in the back was preparing the sandwich - obviously we were mistaken.  This girl proceeded to make one coffee drink after another before even starting my colleague's sandwich!  Finally, with only 5 minutes to spare, she started to scramble the eggs and prepare the sandwich.  We were in this place for 25 minutes waiting for a simple sandwich.  Needless to say, I won't be coming back as the service was atrocious and the food nothing special.  I guess I will stick with Starbucks if I want fast and friendly service.

Meh. Not a big fan of the espresso here. I got four shots over ice with some simple syrup and cream which came out to almost $6...seems pretty expensive but there was no price listed for just espresso so maybe that's just how much it is here. The espresso tasted similar to cold brew-slightly tangy and not at all dark and roasty like espresso should be. There were also a lot of fine espresso grounds  floating in my drink.

My barista was nice enough but as there was no one in the store besides us, I got the vibe that I was bothering him. 

The chocolates were cute but unfortunately I can't have alcohol so I wasn't able to try them.
Forget Starbucks. This place blows it away.

Got a hot mocha and Bagel sandwhich with sausage egg and cheese. I think its the roast of their espresso beans but there's a kind of nutty taste to it which I didn't like and couldn't drink the mocha. Also took a long time to make the sandwhich. Not sure why you would offer hot made food when there is only one employee working, they can't run bar and make food at once. Bad management in my opinion. Even the employee tried to warn me it would take a while.  Not good when you're trying to warn customers off of buying food. Too bad because I am moving close by soon and would love to have a go to locally owned coffee joint.

I adore this coffee shop! This shop, alongside with Sunrise Coffee, are my favorite locally owned coffee shops and I get around. :) Their coffee is my favorite. It's not too sweet but has great flavor and still tastes like coffee. I get an iced Bella Luna and it has coconut, hazelnut and caramel. I also feel the effects of the caffeine. I know that is odd to say but honestly at a few coffee shops I swear they give me de-caf everytime. It's fairly big inside and the seating is versatile. They have tables as well as comfy big chairs. They also have board games! I got their sausage breakfast sandwich once and it was delicious! The croissant that was used was just perfect. So happy to find a favorite coffee shop!

Great selection of specialty drinks and delicious sweets. (I highly recommend the red velvet brownies and wild willies coco nut cake ball) 
The owner and staff are always friendly. Good place to just hangout or to work.

Trendy little joint I would expect to find down town. Pastries look amazing and are made in house. I badly want one, but I'm already cheating on my diet. I got a Happy Italian, an amaretto and caramel flavored coffee drink, and it's damn good. 

Customer service was on point. Starbucks prices. I will be back.

Stopped in and grabbed a few sweets while walking through Grand Bazaar shops.  For such a little shop they had a ton to choose from.  The girl working was friendly and helpful.  I appreciated her suggestions.  I ended up with a Smores Bar, Peach Ciroc Drop, Milk Chocolate Turtle, Wally's Wild Coconut and Debbie's Double Mint.  Everything was ok.  I thought their specialties would have stood out more.  The turtle was my favorite.  I would give them another try if it I was in the area.
Tasty red velvet almond milk latte! Delicious pastries: cheese danish and chocolate croissants.
Lots of fun, interesting flavors! Wide selection of pastries & they have gluten free cookies!!!!!

Very disappointed :( I ordered a red velvet and was quite upset that there was absolutely no flavor red velvet or otherwise. I am not sure if she forgot to put the "red velvet" element in or if worse, it was there but completely and utterly tasteless. I left paying five dollars for a tasteless coffee with foam. I had such high hopes when I walked in and noted the cute and quirky ambiance and selection of truffles and sweets. The red velvet truffle I tried was overpowered by the liqueur taste and left much to be desired. So much potential but fell flat for me...I won't e returning :(

I had to drop my mother off on a Thursday for her P.T. and had an hour to kill...
I loved the atmosphere...much cooler than Starbucks or coffee bean. Perfect place to do work or study. Plus the strawberry smoothie was delicious! Highly recommend

This is a great place to meet with clients and/or get some work done. They have great coffee and super delicious sandwiches. 

The staff are super helpful and they always have smiles. Of course, this is also a great place to get some chocolate liquor goodies and get yourself a little buzz on.
This place is a little out of the way from my house but I always come here if I need a coffee along with something sweet. The truffles are delicious and unique, much better than any cake pop.
Staff was friendly coffee was yummy but the alcohol infused truffles now they were fantastic! Pretty little unique gift I would say.

Love this place. Its local not a giant corporate chain. They make really good coffee and treat their customers well. They really care about what they make and it shows. Every coffee drink is just right. 

I visit almost everyday and have tried every one of their special drinks. Not a bad thing on their menu. Plus they make their own pastries too. The raspberry cheesecake croissant is superb.

Walking in, you notice the atmosphere is very comfy, as you would expect these days from a coffee house. There is a beautiful selection of truffles crafted in-house in the display window, so if you have a sweet tooth, I would totally recommend checking this place out.

I have decided to embark on a new journey of coffees & coffee houses (yeah, I know, I am one or two decades too late to be trendy), but in the past, I have always stuck with plain ole coffee because whenever I tried a fancy coffee drink it was always extremely sweet. So I told the lady behind the counter my worries, and to my surprise she didn't act like my problems were boring (which, let's face it, they are - but she was nice & helpful anyway!) She suggested a marshmallow latte for me. Also, it was lunchtime & I was hungry, so even though she highly recommended the lavender & white chocolate scone, I opted for the chicken salad sandwich on a croissant.

As far as I can tell, the chicken salad was the only lunch option, so I was really surprised that it was not ready to order at 12:45 in the afternoon. To be fair, they finished making the salad within a few minutes of our order, but I still thought it was strange the prep had not been done earlier. The sandwich was very good - the croissant was not the full butter, crazy flaky kind, but a tamer version that is still delicious and that I think works even better on a sandwich. (I think the flaky kind is best enjoyed on it's own, but is too delicate for a sandwich.) And the chicken salad was well made, but it had dried sweetened cranberries, and I would have preferred it without. (Maybe I should have gone with the lavendar & white chocolate scone!) But my friend, who ordered the same sandwich, thought the cranberries were delicious, so it just goes to show these things are a matter of personal taste.

The marshmallow latte was excellent. A little bit of sweet, but I could still taste the roasted coffee. It was a very elegant beverage, and made me feel like I was having a grown up drink in spite of my emotional immaturity! :-) Fantastic suggestion by the barista!

I was really torn as to whether to whether to give 4 or 5 stars. I will just have to go back and see what happens next time!

So happy this place opened up right next to me.  I walked my dog there last Sunday and we sat on the patio and sipped coffee while reading.  Happy as can be.  Good coffee.  Great atmosphere.  Great pastries and macaroons.  I wish they had a few savory options for pastries, maybe a quiche or two, but other than that this is a great addition to the neighborhood.

Amazing little coffe shop !!! 
Recommend this place amazing desert try the passaniot fuirt drop and chocolate chip brownie also got the sneakers blended coffee OMG absolutely delicious coffee  I ever had !!;)

The staff is amazing as always! Love this place and come here all the time. I have to say, the coffee and the espresso are just average. Nothing special. Just average, hence the average rating. I gave this 4 stars last time because the truffles and chocolates are delicious and I didn't get a chance to try anything else. I have no complaints, which makes me come back here all the time. 
The biscotto was a little too hard for me, but the chocolate donut was good. It was soft and moist. I love supporting small businesses and hope this place succeeds!

Came here one afternoon & finally decided to try out this place. I lived nearby & always loved the name idea. The employee was nice, but could have been helpful. My boyfriend & I ordered an iced blue velvet coffee, earl grey hot tea, cinnamon raisin bagel, & their broccoli & cheese soup. The blue velvet iced coffee was the best part, that was yummy. The soups texture & taste were good. Although I'm not sure if it was the oyster crackers, but it was a tad salty. The bagel was way over-toasted to where it was partially burnt. My hot tea wasn't bad at least. Earl grey can never disappoint. This little cafe is super quaint & peaceful. I would definitely come here to study or play scrabble over some coffee one day. Tipsy has a large selection of truffles, drinks, & snacks. It's like when you go to The Cheesecake Factory & just look through their large menu over & over (haha). It's worth a shot to see why they're running for Best of Las Vegas.

WORST. PLACE. EVER!

Wow. Really, this was the WORST cup of coffee I've ever had.....EVER!

How.......how can one mess up a mexi mocha? I'll tell you.....by DROWNING it in cinnamon. I kept wondering if I was in a cinnamon challenge. So, almost nine bucks for disgusting coffee and i TIPPED for that.....WTF! This is why I stick with Dunkin Donuts and The Human Bean. So far, those guys haven't let me down yet!

This place = NO BUENO!!!!

I was so excited when I saw the box. Very cute packaging and presentation!  First I had a liquor filled truffle and I was blown away with flavor, YUMMMY . 
The reason that I only gave 3 stars was because the very pricey cake bombs were just awful. Every one was dry and I couldn't finish any of the six that were included in my gift. Perhaps they had stored up on extras that weren't so fresh because of the holiday? I'm not sure we will return but I'm sure if they stick with the truffles, they'll be the bomb.

A quaint coffee shop with alcohol infused truffles... 

We stopped by to check this place out and really enjoyed the sights, sounds, smells and tastes.

I ordered an iced peach tea and an iced Americano along with a chocolate baileys infused truffle and a coconut Malibu infused truffle. The tea was delcious, they use Barney & Sons so it's good quality. The Americano was also really deep and flavorful. As far as the truffles, the coconut was my preference. The alcohol was a nice mild touch to the rich chocolate and run soaked cake. 

This small business supports other small businesses as you could see on the shelves of goats milk burbon caramel. 

It looks like a comfy spot to stay awhile and has plenty of real plants, comfy chairs and easy listening mud ice. You don't have to keep asking for water either, as they have a nice little self serve station.

I'll be back to try their lunch menu items.
Great Place, nice and quiet, I had this Coffee Tipsy that is very good~ Wish this place will open longer.

Great little coffee shop off the beaten track! Nestled in between Southern Hills Hospital and the medical complex, be sure to check this place out! Freshly brewed coffee and tea, homemade truffles and goodies! I tried the Peach Ginger black tea today ( got it iced) and it was great!

This coffee shop is located in an odd spot off the 215 and Sunset in a medical building area. Pretty smart for them though, everyone will stop in there before and on break of their shifts! Anyways, I'm
a fan of iced coffee and they did it right, I got the red eye, which is iced coffee with a shot of espresso added. I could tell they had just got their new BEAUTIFUL espresso machine because every worker was watching it as it poured my delicious drink! I also opted to have a cranberry scone from here and it's the best I've had in a while. It's funny I actually never, ever go to Starbucks (not a fan of their coffee) but I got a cranberry and orange scone from there and let me tell you Tipsy blew them out of the water by a landslide. Perhaps it's because they bake and prepare everything in house fresh every morning! 
They also had cute little chocolate truffles, that I did not try this time, but I'm sure knowing me I shall sometime soon.
The only downer at this point, is that it has only been open a week, and I understand they are getting everything situated still. But it's not very "coffee shop homie and warm" yet. I love to take my computer and enjoy coffee and pastries while getting some work done and I just didn't feel like I would have been comfy doing that here just yet. Although, I have faith that this place will be full and warm in about a month or so!

Absolutely delicious!!!! They have fun concoction of espresso and coffee drinks. I got the Devils Frappe, which is vanilla ice cream blended with toffee syrup and espresso. I usually can't have sweet things early in the morning, so this was a gamble... to cut out some of the sweetness I added another shot and it worked out perfectly. I thought that it was gonna be more on the frozen side but that was not the case which was perfect for my liking.

They also adorable little treats that are tiny chocolate balls filled with alcohol... I will be back to try those!!

Went in to Tipsy one day when looking for a local coffee shop. I tried the cookie butter latte and it was delicious!! The staff was super friendly and the shop is super cute! Gave four stars because I feel they're a bit overpriced. Definitely will indulge every now and then here though!

This place is adorable and quaint, and the staff is super sweet, so my rating is, in no way, influenced by service or ambiance. Honestly, the ambiance is terrific and there's even a charger pod on some of the tables for our many electronic devices.

I love coffee. I love the flavor of coffee and espresso and I value a delightful craft beverage that highlights those flavors. All things considered, I would recommend Tipsy's lattes to someone who does NOT like the flavor of coffee. The syrups were so powerful and sweet that my Salted Caramel Nutella latte (which sounds amazing, right?) tasted like sugar milk. I know there are yelpers out there who love things like that so if you do, keep on keepin' on, this place is your spot!

I was also disappointed in the pastry selection. Since they focus predominantly on truffles which feels like an odd combination to balance out such sweet beverages, I opted for the only non-truffle food remaining which was a biscotti. Not bad, not great...

I use to go a lot to Tipsy but not anymore ... it's hard to find the shop and parking is small... 
coffee is just okay ... now Vegas has so many great cafe  
Not many choices of pastry

We were so spoiled to have Tipsy Coffee House cater our coffee and breakfast for
The Southern Nevada Association of the Education of the Young Child's Fall Mini-Conference! WOW were we absolutely blown away! The regular and decaf organic locally roasted coffees were simply divine, superb, really exquisitely delicate and delicious! Everyone was raving about it the entire day! Tipsy also spared no detail in offering up gourmet breakfast sandwiches and a delectable array of their signature chocolate truffles which proved to be the talk of our event~! Look out Las Vegas-there's a new cafe confection rock star in town and TIPSY IS IT'S NAME-O!

I went to Tipsy a couple of days ago for the first time. I ordered a latte with almond milk and a ham and egg cheese on a croissant. The latte was really good. The coffee had a nice well rounded flavor, not like the burnt tasting one from Starbucks. The sandwich took a bit, but that is because they make it fresh to order, nothing frozen! It was worth the wait because the croissant was nicely toasted and buttery, while the eggs were light and fluffy. The staff was friendly and courteous. I will definitely come back!

The first time I came into this coffee shop I was skeptical because of how small it looked on the outside but when I walked in the smell of fresh coffee and baked goods filled me up with a relaxing feel. This place is great !
Great place.  Internet is fast.  They sell a drip mug with free refills.  Definite bonus!  Pretty conveniently located.  Nice people.  Privately owned!  Definitely a must try.

Came here for a quick lunch today and had a chicken salad sandwich. It was really good and I enjoyed my flavored iced tea. I took a star away because of customer service. I did not even get a hi, hello or bye from any of employees.

It was a strange location, but the sight of it was welcome in the middle of the nondescript surroundings. While it was easily visible, it didn't seem very accessible.

When my friend and I made our way in, we were greeted and we purchased a couple of ginger scones which were delicious. I inquired about their iced teas and they said they could do any tea as an iced tea. I got an earl gray and my friend got an americano. I saw the barista preparing my tea from a tea bag being steeped and thought that could not bode well, as it can only steep with hot water, and any ice would dilute it. She didn't call us to the counter, but after sitting for a while we went up and checked and there they were. Sure enough, my iced tea was watery, but not terrible, my friends coffee was just okay.

I was starving and expected some savory options, but there were only pre-made sandwiches. While they sounded decent, I know refrigerated bread is never good, and they were pricey at almost $8 a pop. For a pre-made sandwich? Meh.. I'd stick with the freshly made scones. They also offer some boozy chocolates and truffles.

There were two other patrons in there when we went in, and they had ordered a chocolate. They took it to the table and inspected it for a while. Eventually they brought it back up to the counter to let the barista know they had been given the wrong chocolate. She takes the one that had already been given to them and set down on their table and puts it back in the case! Kind of grossed me out.

Some of their coffee drinks involve ice cream, syrups and cake in them, and that's just not really my thing. I like straightforward coffee drinks, I guess I'm a purist. I'm more adventurous with teas though, and I wish I had gotten their Chai so that I could maybe give a more positive review since they make their own Chai mix. I have respect for what they are trying to do, and a coffee spot was much needed in the area. Unfortunately, it didn't win me over.

Tipsy Coffee House is right next door to Southern Hills Hospital. If you're looking to have a latte with a side order of a cute nurse/attractive doctor in scrubs, this is your place. The shop is decorated very well with lots of cool artwork and a fish tank. There are plenty of seats and they are usually pretty empty. My only complaint is that I often get stuck waiting 10-15 minutes for my drink, since there is only one person working. All of the baristas are extremely friendly and hand deliver you your coffee. They have a large selection of truffles and nutella drinkss- every girls favorite! 
Tipsy is a great place to study. It's quiet, empty and the drinks are good!

This is got to be one of the best locally own coffee shops in town. Even the names of their coffee drinks are great. With a housemaid peanut butter that will blow your mind. So glad to have found this hidden gem.

Love the coffee, and the croissants! They run of of my favorite a lot (chocolate ) because I never get there early enough on weekends. But when we do, it's great!
I need to try the chicken salad croissant though!

Finally found a /real/ coffee shop! I was a barista a few times, and I've been looking for a real espresso coffee here in  Vegas and I think I've found it! I had...One of the overly sweet and sugary drinks on ice, and despite all the flavours and sugar, it still tasted like coffee (BTW, this is how I like it) where as the Coffee Bean, Einsten's and Charbucks they make it sugary and delicious, but it doesn't taste like coffee.

The price really pleased me too. It was expensive (something like $5 for my drink and $2 for an americano) but again comparatively to other establishments, it's within reason.

The barista could have been friendlier... But then, I like my coffee slingers jacked up on caffeine and hyped up, so probably no fault of hers.

I'm very excited to have found a new coffee joint!

After finishing up my doctors appointment I stopped by this little gem of a shop. It's so adorable! They have these super cute little chocolates and other baked goods along with some knick knacks you can purchase like tumblers and shirts. 

I opted to go with an iced coconut coffee with soy milk. It was very good! Not too over powering in flavor and a very good flavor.

I wish this place was closer I'd definitely come here more often. Also a drive thru would be great for quicker access when just passing by but probably would draw away from the little small business feel.

I loved this place, the chocolate was yummy, the place was quiet and relaxed while we were there and the staff was lovely. They have games that people can sit down and play with their friends. The only thing I found a bummer was their early close times. However I understand that because of their location staying open later in the evening is really just a waste of money for them. Still sad.. :(

A cute cafe-bakery, Tipsy has unique, cozy drinks and delicious sweet treats to accompany them. Most of their products appear to be concocted and assembled in-house, including the truffles, and the whole place has that modern but homemade feel that sets it apart from trendier, perhaps more shallow joints. 

I felt welcome from the start of my visit thanks to the incredibly patient and engaging staff, and the warmth of their happy customers. The barista was very kind and personable, and I even met a regular who has a drink named after him! Tells a lot about just how local this place is. 

I thoroughly enjoyed their homemade chai, and the chocolate dipped strawberry that the regular mister so kindly ordered for me as I was trying to decide what to get. As commonplace as chai tea and chocolate can be, Tipsy provides a nice, distinct take on both - I can't pinpoint what it is exactly, but whatever it is, I'm glad they've taken the time to personalize their formulas to set themselves apart. 

I'm hoping they open a little later, eventually, maybe when people finally discover that there's a much more charming option here than the Starbucks down the street. I'll definitely be dropping in semi-regularly to see what they're stirring up next!

Tipsy has the best coffee I have ever tasted! It's now my favorite place for coffee! I tried Americana and it was strong and fresh. The handmade chocolate is also a must try. I was surprised that some of they are infused with real liquor! They had a new item which was mango and pineapple crepe cake, not too sweet, very yummy! 

I will definitely come back again!

Hot almond milk latte with white chocolate and peanut butter... Heaven! I love that they use real, fresh peanut butter. I come here weekly for my coffee treat and am never disappointed. The place is a nice chill spot, too. Coffee house indie music, comfy couches and chairs, wi-fi and board games. The type of place I spent hours in when I was in school. They also have food and tasty treats including some absolutely amazing cake pops - even some filled with liqueors!

Went to a doctors appointment and came across this little coffee shop. The guy at the cashier was very friendly but wasn't that knowledgable about all the pastries. He says he only tried one of em. My boyfriend asked what one of them were because it didn't have a sign and he didn't even know. They have so many items to choose from! In the case, all of their truffles are made with alcohol. 

I got the cookies and cream vodka truffle. I took a bite and could taste that vodka haha. Super strong, but I enjoyed it. Also got the hazelnut liquor truffle with butterscotch. Way less taste of alcohol but very yummy too. 

Besides their truffles, they also have food like chicken noodle soup and sandwiches. 

The drink menu... man I had such a hard time choosing! Haha. Because I usually don't drink lattes. The thought of cookie butter melting into my mouth made my mouth water. You can order any latte iced or hot or frappe. I got an iced cookie butter latte. It was pretty good. All the chunks of cookie butter stayed at the bottom. I'm not sure if it was supposed to be more melted with the espresso or not but I still enjoyed it. 

My boyfriend got a monster smoothie made with fruits. If you're trying to wake up, that drink will do it! The monster taste was very strong. I was hoping it would taste more fruity. He liked it though.

The cafe is empty and quiet during the day and there are board games and stuff to play. I think I have found my new study spot. :)

This place is totally out of my way, I do drive there anyway, because there is not a yummier coffee and treats are just delicious.  Not only the coffee and the treats are to die for, the staff is just amazing and so friendly.
I realize I do have a new addiction - Tipsy coffee

Tried giving the local coffee shop  some business over the Starbucks near by.  Cozy place not very friendly,  all I can say is that my almost $7 triple latte was served warm at best with 2 shots at the most.  I struggle with the price for such a poorly made product.  Haven't been back since although I hear their liquor filled chocolates are great.
Good coffee and truffles. Quiet studying environment. I'll definitely be coming here often!
Ordered a large dirty chai. Was kinda pricey I thought and seemed a bit watery. Will try again as we try and support local business. Seems to have a cool vibe.

This place is so cute. Definitely my new hangout spot since it's pretty low key and not crowded like the other 100 hipster places. They have such AMAZING food, coffee, and truffles! I came in here early 11am and left at 330pm without being bothered or asked to leave! They respected me to stay and leave me in peace to work. The workers were friendly but mostly hid in the back :( I absolutely love this place and will be coming back for my spinach egg croissant sandwich!!!! Soooooo amazing :) this place is also really clean and has the most amazing smelling bathrooms :)
Awesome customer service!!  Had a regular coffee here and It was great!! Love the atmosphere will definitely be back to try the truffles. Wish they were open longer

We've passed by this place everyday for the past 6 months, always wondered how it fared with the mighty giants like Starbucks & CBTL. Today I decided to have an impromptu coffee date with my little princess. When we got there at 10, the place was empty except for an old man sitting in a corner. A young lady was behind the counter (very snobbish and the whole time acted like I was bothering her) No good morning or some type of pleasantries exchanged. Immediately you feel the awkwardness. 

Being that my daughter is 3 and can't have coffee I asked what they had that she could have. Nothing besides a couple of fruit smoothies and some juices she said. Okay, so since she likes Nutella can I have that drink but without the espresso shot? She said they've never done that before but she can try (that kinda made me nervous)

So I ended up ordering The salted Scottie latte (Nutella & salted caramel, sounds super yummy right?) and Nutella latte (minus the espresso shot) for my daughter. We also got a croissant and a Honey lavender scone along with some truffles to go, Limony Cello and Val's hazelnut thingie. The food was ok, nothing really special to elaborate. The Nutella drink was generic tasting, mind you she charged me full price $5.09 for the small even without the espresso. Now my latte is the last straw, at $5.85 for a small size you would think it would taste somewhat decent but NO, it tasted like coffee diluted with a whole lot of water. It was bland, you couldn't taste the coffee nor the sugar. So I told the girl I was not pleased with the drink. She did ask if I wanted something else instead but between the ordinary food and the lack of service, I told her no and kindly just asked for my money back, I couldn't take any more disappointment. I'm all for supporting small businesses but if you offer subpar food, pricey coffee (I don't mind paying if the quality is there) and not so great service then there's really nothing worth going. Needless to say I ended up in the nearest Starbucks drive thru and ordered my tall caramel macchiato for $3.95

Come for the coffee but stay for the chocolate!!!

Tipsy Coffee House is a locally owned coffee house and bakery. They have a great selection of coffees and the desserts all are handmade. Along side with a selection of breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  

Tipsy Coffee House lines itself with luscious chocolate truffles decorated with shimmering, artistic frosting adds a nice aura. They have an assortment of alcoholic and non-alcoholic truffles. For those wondering you can definitely taste the alcohol, it's nothing overpowering but it does grab your attention really quick. It's like Turbo Boost for your taste buds, the chocolate itself is fine and dissolves perfectly. I can see why people come here, the truffles are amazing, I don't mind being addicted to Tipsy.  

These are favorites: Jane's Whiskey Gingersnap, Vodka infused Double Mint & Bailey's Irish Cream 

Tipsy is a charming little coffee shop filled with nice and friendly people.
 I'll definitely be returning back.

I've never had a worse Mexican mocha. I took one sip and trashed the rest. Awful. Will not be returning. On the plus side everything is really pretty to look at. I'd get a coffee drink somewhere else though

This quaint little coffee shop is tucked away at the west end of Sunset Blvd and since I'm over here today I stopped by and asked for a white chocolate mocha - iced. This coffee drink was creamy, light and slightly sweetened - over all it's pretty delicious! They also sell a lot of yummy chocolate and desserts but I can't afford the calories right now so I'll have to come back and try more espresso drinks later.

There are really nice couches and chair to sit as well as tables and chairs. I wish this place was closer to my apartment!
Super good coffee , especially Ali baba latte. Nice handcrafted display. Will make you wanna go back there often!
Came here for coffee very peaceful not a lot of crazy busy people relax environment and soothing music goo to drink and leave relaxed

awesome service awesome coffee.

My LV coffee tour continues... and Tipsy gets an easy 5 stars from me and the hubby.
The barista was courteous and let us know "I will be with you in a few minutes" he was carefully making a drink for the couple ahead of us. We had the perfect amount of time to take everything in and figure out what we wanted from the drink menu.
The truffles and homemade reese's peanut butter cups looked awesome in the pastry case. Chocolate covered pretzel sticks with sprinkles? They looked awesome. It was too early in the morning to try it out but I will definitely try it out next time.

I had the Cafe Tipsy (dark chocolate & tiramisu mocha) and my husband tried a blended Ali baba (salted caramel & white chocolate mocha). While it took a short while to make, I didn't mind one extra second. It was very obvious that this barista was awesome and he took pride in the drinks he made --- my drink was AWEsome with a capital A-W-E. It was well mixed and you could taste the quality of the espresso, and even the chocolate itself. The drink alone was worth 5 stars. My husband's drink was just the right mix of flavors and while it was sweet-- it wasn't too sweet. It was the right ratio of caramely goodness and coffee.

Hands down, Tipsy is up there on my list of coffee shops - I would say top 3.  We really had a great all-around experience and we will definitely be back for a lot more.

this place is a MUST for coffeelovers in the surrounding areas... and let me know how those chocolate-dipped pretzels are.

This is such a cozy and unique coffee shop behind Southern Hills Hospital! I love that it's not your same old chain coffee place. It offers some one of a kind drinks along with all of the tried and true favorites! My favorite is Nutella latte!

The servers are friendly and the seating is comfortable. The coffee is brewed to perfection! I quit caffeine recently but when I'm back into it again I can't wait to enjoy a frothy, delicious latte from here!

I stopped by here after passing a number of times. I ordered a hot chocolate, truffles and a sandwich. The hot chocolate wasn't very good at all. Seemed like a warm chocolate milk, but with half the chocolate that you would normally put. Truffles are good, but way too expensive!  They bring in the sandwiches from a place in town daily (that's what they told me). I had the turkey and provolone on a cranberry bread. It was decently flavored but very dry. The bread added a nice sweetness to the meat and cheese. It was almost $7 for a pre-packaged sandwich! 

This place gets a 3/5 stars from me for my drink, truffles and sandwich. It gets 5/5 for customer service and atmosphere. If I could I would give it a 3.5/5. It's too expensive.

Awesome cafe!! Loved the vibe. The inside is very clean. It was pretty quiet but I was there on a off time. There are a couple tv's to watch and keep posted on sports or news. The furniture is amazing, feels like I'm in a lounge! There is also a fish tank which I really enjoyed watching as I ate. The coffee and food were really good, I ordered a cinnamon roll with a large coffee. I will definitely be back!

Came here In a Friday morning and the place wasn't too busy. I ordered the Allie Baba drink which was white chocolate and salted Carmel latte and it blew my socks off. It still had a strong coffee flavor and the syrup flavoring didn't overpower that which I liked and I could still taste the saltiness of the caramel. They have a wide range of specialty drinks and I definitely gonna come back whenever I'm in the area. 

I'm knocking one star off because of the pricing it was about $5 after taxes. And because I felt like the staff could've been friendlier and welcoming or explained some of the offered some input regarding the menu items to me because I did feel rushed to order since I took some time browse the menu and the staff who took my order just stood over me which I didn't like.
Alcohol filled truffles?!? What more can you ask for?!? This bakery offers a variety of items sure to please any palate. Very friendly and helpful staff. Can't wait for my next visit!!

Don't ever go this place. Went in for coffee and a cookie. Waited long time just to get one coffee and one bag of cookie. Coffee was cold and cookie was dry as rock. I don't understand how they train thier employees but nobody seems to know what they are doing. Its a shame how they even open the door for business. They should be a shame.

Walked over to the Tipsey Coffee House from a medical office and to my suprise, had on of the most delicious scones I have had since I moved to Las Vegas 17 years ago.  I live in Henderson, but will make a special trip to "Tipsey" for scones.....Oh, did I mention they are home made, I did ask who their supplier is and the answers was,,,"we make them here"...that was all I needed to hear....when I go back for scones, I will also sample more of the menu.
love love love this place! I ordered a chai tea that is made in house being a tea drink I already knew that chai's can all taste different. The employee let me taste it until it was just right :]
My favorite cafe. They are so nice and offered on the house latte with dessert. I love it here and definitely coming back

Pretty darn good coffee, and I also got their chicken salad sandwich in a croissant, soooo good!!!  I don't know what they do to it but it's amazing. 

It's also all very fairly priced, it's almost as if it's a cute little boutique except for sandwiches, little cookies and adorable teacup sets for sale.  

I would definitely recommend, bombdotcom. Great service too.

This place gets four stars because it's a clever little idea and a really smart location. It's near all kinds of medical buildings and I stopped in on a whim because I was early to my appointment. 
I ordered the white mocha espresso iced and then took four tipsy truffles to go, and a gingerbread man cookie. You can tell that the items are handmade. The gingerbread man was still pretty fresh, even a little soft. The coffee tastes fresh but I won't be able to give an accurate review on the coffee until I try it black. 
The real star though, those truffles. I was certainly not expecting the pop or that ACTUAL shot of liquor! They have so many of them and if you have more than a few, it's safe to say you'll need a DD if your drinking tolerance is anything like mine. 
I expected it to be just a little bit of liquor.... When in reality it ended up being a small veil of chocolate to encapsulate a mouthful of your favorite alcohol. 
Pretty special stuff. See all the pics.... Or you'll be standing there forever trying to decide. Ask for a sample too! They'll happily oblige!

I love small coffee shops! The drinks are unique and the truffles look amazing (though I have not tried them). I went for the Mexican Mocha which was good but not great. It lacked the real Mexican hot chocolate taste of cinnamon. My friends loved the Blue Velvet and the Red Velvet.

Service was super friendly but also super slow.... I would give it a 3.5 stars but since I like small businesses and small coffee shops, I round up.

Came here mid-morning on a weekday, so naturally the place was completely empty. 

The cashier was friendly and helpful. This would be a nice quiet place to come get some work done or study, since it's so empty, and they have lots of chairs, tables, and sofas to work at. 

I had the spinach, egg, and cheese croissant and a 12 oz cafe au lait. The croissant could have been flakier, the egg could have been fluffier, and the coffee could have been hotter. The breakfast sandwiches are "made to order," but I have a feeling the egg and cheese were prepared fresh, then sandwiched between two spinach croissants (the tart kind, not a real croissant) that had been sitting in the case. The coffee comes in a paper cup, even if you get it "for here." 

They have a lot of specialty drinks and desserts that look like fun, but I am not really into fancy coffee drinks - love lattes, americanos, regular coffee, etc., but I don't really like "coffee" drinks that taste like sugar with a splash of coffee. That being said, this is a cute little spot if you're working nearby!
